title: UK DLT: Pioneering Transformative Financial Innovation in Wholesale Markets
body: BitcoinWorld UK DLT: Pioneering Transformative Financial Innovation in Wholesale Markets Are you ready for a seismic shift in the world of finance? The UK government is setting the stage for a groundbreaking initiative, empowering its wholesale financial market to delve deep into the potential of UK DLT and tokenization. This isn’t just about adopting new tech; it’s about fundamentally reshaping how financial transactions are conducted, promising unprecedented efficiency, transparency, and innovation. What is Driving Wholesale Finance DLT Adoption? The global financial landscape is constantly evolving, and distributed ledger technology (DLT) is at the forefront of this transformation. For the wholesale financial market, DLT offers a compelling proposition: the ability to streamline complex processes, reduce intermediaries, and enhance security. Imagine a world where asset transfers are instantaneous, settlement risks are minimized, and audit trails are immutable. This is the promise of wholesale finance DLT . Traditionally, wholesale financial markets, which include large-scale transactions between institutions like banks, investment funds, and corporations, have been characterized by multi-party reconciliation, lengthy settlement cycles, and and high operational costs. DLT, the underlying technology behind cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum, provides a shared, immutable ledger that all participants can access and verify in real-time. This shared source of truth can drastically cut down on reconciliation efforts and associated risks. Key drivers for DLT adoption in wholesale finance include: Efficiency Gains: Automating manual processes and reducing settlement times from days to seconds. Cost Reduction: Lowering operational expenses by minimizing intermediaries and manual reconciliation. Enhanced Transparency: Providing a single, immutable record visible to all authorized participants. Reduced Risk: Mitigating counterparty risk and operational errors through automation and shared ledgers. Unlocking Transformative DLT Use Cases The UK’s strategic move is centered on identifying and nurturing the most impactful DLT use cases within its wholesale financial sector. This proactive approach aims to move beyond theoretical discussions to practical, implementable solutions that can deliver tangible benefits. The potential applications are vast and varied, touching almost every facet of wholesale finance. Let’s explore some of the most promising DLT applications: DLT Use Case Description Potential Benefits Digital Bonds & Securities Issuing and managing traditional bonds and other securities as digital tokens on a DLT platform. Instant settlement, fractional ownership, reduced issuance costs, increased liquidity. Repurchase Agreements (Repos) Executing repo transactions on a DLT, facilitating collateral management and cash settlement. Automated lifecycle management, real-time collateral adjustments, reduced counterparty risk. Fund Management & Distribution Tokenizing fund units to streamline subscription, redemption, and transfer processes. Improved transparency, lower administration fees, broader access for investors. Derivatives & Structured Products Creating and managing complex financial instruments on DLT, enabling automated margining and settlement. Enhanced risk management, reduced disputes, greater efficiency in complex transactions. Cross-Border Payments Facilitating international payments using DLT for faster, cheaper, and more transparent transfers. Reduced foreign exchange costs, real-time tracking, improved reconciliation. By providing a supportive environment, the UK government is enabling financial institutions to experiment and validate these applications, moving them from pilot projects to mainstream adoption. The Power of Tokenization Solutions in the UK Hand-in-hand with DLT, tokenization solutions are poised to revolutionize how assets are owned, traded, and managed. Tokenization involves representing real-world assets (like real estate, art, or even commodities) or traditional financial instruments (like stocks and bonds) as digital tokens on a blockchain or DLT. Each token can represent a share of ownership, making assets more liquid, divisible, and accessible. The UK’s focus on tokenization signals a clear intent to unlock new avenues for capital formation and investment. For the wholesale market, tokenization means: Increased Liquidity: Making illiquid assets more tradable by dividing them into smaller, tokenized units. Fractional Ownership: Enabling multiple investors to own a portion of a high-value asset, democratizing investment. Automated Compliance: Embedding regulatory rules directly into the tokens themselves via smart contracts, ensuring compliance at every step. Reduced Intermediaries: Cutting out layers of brokers and custodians, leading to lower costs and faster transactions. The regulatory sandbox approach being considered by the UK is crucial here. It allows for controlled experimentation with tokenized securities and other assets, providing a safe space for innovation while ensuring consumer protection and market stability. Fostering Financial Innovation in a Regulated Environment The UK’s ambition is not just to adopt new technology but to lead in financial innovation . This involves creating a regulatory framework that is both forward-looking and robust. The government’s plan to enable the wholesale market to identify DLT use cases is a testament to this commitment. It acknowledges that innovation thrives when industry and regulators collaborate to understand the nuances and implications of emerging technologies. Key aspects of the UK’s approach to fostering innovation include: Regulatory Sandboxes: Providing a controlled environment for firms to test innovative products and services without immediate full regulatory burden. Task Forces & Working Groups: Bringing together industry experts, regulators, and technologists to discuss challenges and opportunities. Policy Development: Crafting clear and adaptable regulations that support DLT adoption while mitigating risks like market manipulation, cybersecurity threats, and money laundering. This balanced approach is vital. It allows the UK to capitalize on the benefits of DLT and tokenization without compromising the stability and integrity of its financial system. By proactively engaging with the wholesale market, the government ensures that policy development is informed by real-world needs and challenges. Challenges and the Road Ahead While the potential is immense, the journey to widespread DLT adoption in wholesale finance is not without its hurdles. Key challenges include: Regulatory Clarity: Ensuring a consistent and clear legal framework across jurisdictions. Interoperability: Developing standards that allow different DLT platforms to communicate seamlessly. Scalability: Ensuring DLT networks can handle the massive transaction volumes of wholesale markets. Cybersecurity: Protecting DLT systems from sophisticated cyber threats. Talent Gap: Addressing the shortage of skilled professionals in DLT and blockchain technologies. The UK government’s collaborative approach, involving industry and regulators, is designed to systematically address these challenges. By identifying the “best use cases,” they are prioritizing areas where DLT can deliver the most immediate and significant impact, building momentum for broader adoption. The UK is making a definitive statement: it intends to be a global leader in the digital transformation of finance. By empowering its wholesale financial market to explore and implement UK DLT and tokenization solutions , the government is not just embracing technology; it’s strategically positioning the nation for a future where financial markets are more efficient, transparent, and accessible. This pioneering approach to identifying DLT use cases will undoubtedly spark significant financial innovation , setting a precedent for other global financial hubs. The journey ahead will require continuous collaboration and adaptation, but the foundation is being laid for a truly transformative era in wholesale finance. To learn more about the latest DLT and tokenization trends, explore our article on key developments shaping financial innovation and institutional adoption. This post UK DLT: Pioneering Transformative Financial Innovation in Wholesale Markets first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Fort Worth Bitcoin Mining: A Bold Leap Towards Municipal Crypto Adoption
body: BitcoinWorld Fort Worth Bitcoin Mining: A Bold Leap Towards Municipal Crypto Adoption In a groundbreaking move that has sent ripples through the cryptocurrency world and beyond, Fort Worth, Texas, has officially stepped into the future by becoming the first U.S. city to engage in Fort Worth Bitcoin mining . This isn’t just a symbolic gesture; it’s a tangible commitment to embracing digital innovation, with three Bitcoin mining rigs now operating 24/7 within the hallowed halls of city hall. For anyone tracking the evolution of digital assets and their integration into mainstream society, this development marks a pivotal moment, signaling a potential new era for how cities manage resources and engage with emerging technologies. Fort Worth Bitcoin Mining: A Groundbreaking Initiative at City Hall The news, initially reported by Fox News 4 and amplified by Walter Bloomberg on X, confirms that Fort Worth has installed three Bitmain Antminer S9 rigs, which will run continuously for a six-month trial period. While three rigs might seem like a modest start in the vast landscape of global Bitcoin mining operations, the significance lies not in the scale, but in the precedent. This isn’t a private enterprise; it’s a municipal government, a public entity, directly participating in the decentralized network of Bitcoin. This bold step by Fort Worth’s city leadership demonstrates a forward-thinking approach, recognizing the potential of blockchain technology and digital currencies to contribute to local economies and public services. The decision to place these rigs within city hall itself is particularly symbolic. It brings a cutting-edge technology, often perceived as abstract or complex, directly into the heart of civic administration. This physical presence can serve as a powerful educational tool, demystifying Bitcoin for citizens and potentially fostering greater understanding and acceptance of cryptocurrencies. It’s a clear statement that Fort Worth is not just observing the digital revolution; it’s actively participating in it, aiming to harness its benefits for its residents. The Strategic Vision Behind Municipal Crypto Adoption: Why Now? Why would a city embark on a municipal crypto mining venture? The rationale extends beyond mere novelty. Fort Worth’s initiative is rooted in a strategic vision to position the city as a hub for technology and innovation. In an increasingly digital world, cities are competing to attract talent, investment, and future-proof industries. By embracing Bitcoin mining, Fort Worth signals its openness to new ideas and its willingness to experiment with disruptive technologies. Several key drivers likely influenced this decision: Economic Diversification: Exploring new revenue streams beyond traditional taxes and fees. Bitcoin mining, while volatile, offers a unique opportunity to generate income directly from a global digital asset. Innovation Hub Development: Attracting blockchain companies, developers, and enthusiasts to the city, fostering a vibrant tech ecosystem. This can lead to job creation and economic growth in emerging sectors. Public Awareness and Education: Serving as a tangible example of blockchain technology in action, which can help educate the public and local businesses about its potential applications. Future-Proofing Infrastructure: Gaining hands-on experience with decentralized technologies that may play a significant role in future public services, from supply chain management to secure record-keeping. This proactive stance by Fort Worth’s leadership suggests a long-term view on the role of digital assets in the global economy, aiming to secure a competitive edge for the city in the evolving technological landscape. Unpacking the Benefits of City Hall Bitcoin Mining: What’s in it for Fort Worth? While the immediate financial gains from three mining rigs might be modest, the benefits of this city hall Bitcoin project extend far beyond simple revenue. Fort Worth is investing in experience, visibility, and future potential. Let’s delve into the multi-faceted advantages: Potential Revenue Generation Every block mined contributes Bitcoin to the miner. While the three S9 rigs are not industrial-scale operations, they will generate a continuous, albeit small, stream of Bitcoin. Over time, and especially if Bitcoin’s value appreciates, these earnings could contribute to city coffers, potentially funding public services or further technological initiatives. This creates a novel, non-tax-based revenue stream, diversifying the city’s financial portfolio. Energy Efficiency and Sustainability (A Key Discussion Point) One of the most common criticisms of Bitcoin mining is its energy consumption. However, Fort Worth’s approach could serve as a case study in responsible mining. Many municipalities have access to existing infrastructure and potentially underutilized energy capacity, especially during off-peak hours. If the city can power these rigs using excess or renewable energy sources, it transforms a perceived negative into a positive, showcasing how Bitcoin mining can be integrated sustainably. The small scale also means minimal additional load on the grid, making it an efficient use of existing resources. Establishing Technological Leadership By being the first U.S. city to directly mine Bitcoin, Fort Worth immediately gains recognition as a pioneer. This enhances its brand as an innovative and tech-forward city, which can attract tech companies, startups, and skilled workers looking for an environment that embraces emerging technologies. This leadership position can lead to a virtuous cycle of innovation and economic growth. Public Education and Engagement The presence of mining rigs at city hall offers a unique opportunity for public engagement. Imagine school groups visiting, learning about blockchain, and seeing Bitcoin mining in action. This hands-on exposure can demystify complex concepts, foster digital literacy, and inspire a new generation of tech innovators within the community. It turns an abstract concept into a tangible reality. Navigating the Challenges of Public Sector Blockchain: What Are the Risks? No pioneering venture comes without its challenges, and Fort Worth’s foray into public sector blockchain is no exception. While the benefits are compelling, the city must also prudently manage potential risks and criticisms. Market Volatility of Bitcoin Bitcoin’s price is notoriously volatile. The value of the mined Bitcoin can fluctuate wildly, impacting the revenue generated. The city will need a clear strategy for managing these assets, whether holding them, converting them to fiat, or using them for specific purposes, to mitigate financial risk. Energy Consumption and Environmental Concerns Despite the small scale, any mention of Bitcoin mining often triggers concerns about its environmental footprint. Fort Worth will need to be transparent about the energy source for its rigs and demonstrate a commitment to sustainability. Proactive communication and, ideally, reliance on renewable energy or utilizing excess power, will be crucial to maintaining public support. Regulatory Uncertainty The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies in the U.S. is still evolving. While Bitcoin mining itself is generally legal, future regulations regarding digital asset holdings by municipal entities could emerge. Fort Worth will need to stay abreast of these developments and adapt its operations accordingly. Security Risks Operating Bitcoin mining rigs, even on a small scale, involves security considerations. Protecting the physical hardware from theft or damage, and safeguarding the digital wallets where mined Bitcoin is stored, are paramount. Cybersecurity measures must be robust to prevent hacking attempts or other malicious activities. Public Acceptance and Skepticism Not everyone is a crypto enthusiast. Some citizens may view this initiative with skepticism, seeing it as a waste of taxpayer money or an unnecessary risk. Effective public relations and transparent reporting on the project’s performance will be essential to build trust and demonstrate value to the broader community. Fort Worth’s Bold Step: A Precedent for Crypto Adoption Across the Nation? Fort Worth’s decision could be a significant turning point for broader crypto adoption within governmental structures across the United States. When a city takes such a visible and direct step, it sends a powerful message that cryptocurrencies are not just for tech enthusiasts or private investors, but are legitimate tools with potential applications for public good. This initiative could inspire other municipalities to: Explore Similar Mining Ventures: Cities with favorable energy costs or renewable energy surpluses might consider their own small-scale mining operations as a new revenue source. Investigate Blockchain for Public Services: Beyond mining, cities might look into using blockchain for more secure record-keeping, transparent voting systems, efficient supply chain management for municipal procurements, or even issuing municipal bonds on a blockchain. Accept Cryptocurrency Payments: If cities are comfortable mining Bitcoin, they might become more open to accepting Bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies for taxes, fees, or utility payments, enhancing convenience for citizens. Foster Local Crypto Economies: By embracing crypto at a municipal level, cities can encourage local businesses to also adopt digital assets, potentially creating localized crypto economies that attract new businesses and talent. Fort Worth is essentially running a live experiment, and the results of their six-month trial will be closely watched. A successful outcome could provide a blueprint for other cities, demonstrating that prudent engagement with cryptocurrencies can yield tangible benefits and contribute to urban innovation. What Lies Ahead: The Future of Fort Worth’s Bitcoin Venture The initial six-month trial period will be crucial for Fort Worth. During this time, the city will likely monitor the performance of the rigs, the revenue generated, the energy consumption, and public reception. The insights gained will inform future decisions regarding the scalability and long-term viability of the project. Possible future scenarios include: Expansion: If the trial is successful and the benefits outweigh the challenges, Fort Worth might consider expanding its mining operations, perhaps by adding more rigs or exploring larger-scale facilities. Integration into Broader Blockchain Strategy: The mining initiative could be just the first step in a more comprehensive blockchain strategy for the city, exploring applications in smart contracts for city services, digital identity, or even municipal stablecoins. Data Transparency: To maintain public trust and provide valuable lessons for other cities, Fort Worth would ideally publish regular reports on the project’s performance, including revenue, energy usage, and operational costs. Collaboration: The city might seek partnerships with private sector blockchain companies to enhance its capabilities, provide expertise, or explore joint ventures. Fort Worth’s pioneering spirit sets a powerful example. Their willingness to explore new frontiers in technology, even in the traditionally conservative public sector, marks a significant milestone in the journey towards a more digitally integrated future. The world will be watching to see how this bold experiment unfolds and what lessons it offers for the broader adoption of cryptocurrencies in civic life. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin institutional adoption. This post Fort Worth Bitcoin Mining: A Bold Leap Towards Municipal Crypto Adoption first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: US Crypto Regulation: House Republicans’ Stunning Setback Halts Key Cryptocurrency Legislation
body: BitcoinWorld US Crypto Regulation: House Republicans’ Stunning Setback Halts Key Cryptocurrency Legislation Was this supposed to be the week that finally brought clarity to the tumultuous world of digital assets in the United States? The crypto community certainly hoped so. After months, even years, of anticipation, two pivotal pieces of cryptocurrency legislation were on the cusp of reaching the House floor for a full vote. Yet, in a dramatic turn of events, those hopes were dashed. House Republicans, unable to muster the necessary votes for a procedural motion, effectively blocked these crucial crypto bills from advancing, leaving the future of US crypto regulation hanging in the balance. This unexpected halt has sent ripples through the market and raised significant questions about the path forward for digital asset policy. What Just Happened with US Crypto Regulation? The legislative process in the U.S. Congress can be complex, and often, the biggest hurdles aren’t the final votes on a bill’s substance, but the procedural steps required to even get it to the floor. In this instance, House Republicans attempted to bring two significant cryptocurrency bills – widely believed to be the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century Act (FIT21) and a stablecoin bill – to a plenary vote under a ‘suspension of the rules’ procedure. This method is typically used for non-controversial bills or those with broad bipartisan support, as it requires a two-thirds majority vote to pass. Unfortunately, the procedural motion failed. This means that despite the efforts of proponents, these bills could not bypass the usual committee processes and be fast-tracked for a full House vote. The immediate consequence is a significant delay, and potentially, the shelving of these specific legislative efforts for the foreseeable future. Infinity Hedge, reporting via Telegram, aptly summarized the sentiment: this will not be the ‘crypto week’ in the U.S. that many had eagerly awaited. Why Did the Procedural Motion Fail, and What Does It Mean for Cryptocurrency Legislation? The failure of a procedural motion often signals deeper divisions than might appear on the surface. While the exact reasons for the lack of two-thirds support aren’t always immediately clear, several factors could have contributed: Bipartisan Disagreement: Despite some bipartisan efforts on crypto, significant disagreements persist between Democrats and Republicans on the scope, nature, and oversight of digital assets. Some Democrats may view these bills as too favorable to the industry or lacking sufficient consumer protections. Internal Party Divisions: Even within the Republican caucus, there might be differing opinions on how to approach crypto regulation, leading to a lack of unanimous support needed for a supermajority vote. Regulatory Turf Wars: The debate over which existing agencies (e.g., SEC vs. CFTC) should have primary oversight over various digital assets continues to be a contentious issue, complicating legislative efforts. Timing and Priorities: With a busy legislative calendar and an election year looming, some members may have prioritized other issues or felt there wasn’t enough time to properly debate such complex legislation under a fast-track procedure. For cryptocurrency legislation, this failure is a major setback. It underscores the difficulty of passing comprehensive digital asset laws in a politically divided Congress. Without a clear regulatory framework, the crypto industry in the U.S. continues to operate in a gray area, facing uncertainty that can stifle innovation and deter institutional investment. The Broader Impact on Digital Asset Policy and the Crypto Market The blocking of these crypto bills has immediate and long-term implications for the entire digital asset ecosystem. The crypto market, which thrives on clarity and certainty, often reacts negatively to regulatory ambiguities or setbacks. Immediate Market Reaction: While specific price movements are influenced by many factors, news of regulatory delays or failures can contribute to: Increased Volatility: Uncertainty can lead to more speculative trading and wider price swings. Investor Hesitation: Both retail and institutional investors may adopt a ‘wait and see’ approach, slowing down capital inflow. Innovation Stifled: Companies might delay product launches or expansion plans in the U.S. due to the lack of clear rules. Long-Term Implications for Digital Asset Policy: This legislative roadblock could have profound effects on the U.S.’s standing in the global crypto landscape: Aspect Potential Impact of Legislative Delay Innovation & Competitiveness The U.S. risks falling behind other jurisdictions (e.g., EU with MiCA, UAE, Singapore) that are actively developing clear regulatory frameworks. Crypto businesses may choose to establish operations elsewhere. Consumer Protection Without comprehensive legislation, consumers and investors may remain vulnerable to scams, hacks, and market manipulation, as existing laws are often ill-suited for digital assets. Institutional Adoption Large financial institutions require regulatory clarity to fully engage with crypto. Delays hinder their participation, limiting the market’s growth and maturity. National Security Clear regulations are essential for combating illicit finance and ensuring the integrity of the financial system in the age of digital currencies. A fragmented approach creates loopholes. The continued lack of a cohesive digital asset policy means that the U.S. relies on enforcement actions and fragmented interpretations of existing laws, creating a patchwork regulatory environment that is challenging for businesses and confusing for consumers. What’s Next for US Crypto Regulation and Crypto Bills? Despite this setback, the push for comprehensive US crypto regulation is far from over. The crypto industry and its advocates in Congress are tenacious, and the underlying need for clarity remains. So, what are the potential paths forward? Potential Avenues for Future Cryptocurrency Legislation: Reintroduction and Committee Process: The bills could be reintroduced and go through the traditional committee process, allowing for more debate, amendments, and potentially, bipartisan compromises. This is a slower but potentially more robust path. Standalone Bills: Elements of the comprehensive bills might be broken down into smaller, more digestible standalone bills, focusing on specific aspects like stablecoins or market structure, which might have an easier time garnering support. Executive Action & Agency Guidance: In the absence of new laws, executive agencies (like the SEC, CFTC, Treasury) will continue to issue guidance and pursue enforcement actions based on existing statutes. While not ideal for the industry, this is a de facto form of regulation. Election Impact: The upcoming elections could shift the political landscape, potentially creating new opportunities or challenges for crypto legislation depending on the composition of the next Congress. Actionable Insights for the Crypto Community: For those invested in the future of digital assets, this setback is a reminder of the importance of engagement: Stay Informed: Keep abreast of legislative developments and the positions of your elected officials. Advocate: Support organizations that lobby for sensible crypto regulation. Contact your representatives to share your views on the importance of clear rules for innovation and consumer protection. Educate: Help bridge the knowledge gap about digital assets. Many policymakers still lack a deep understanding of the technology and its potential. The failure of House Republicans to pass the procedural motion highlights the deep-seated challenges in achieving comprehensive cryptocurrency legislation. It’s a stark reminder that while the crypto industry is rapidly evolving, the political process moves at its own pace, often hindered by partisan divides and procedural complexities. A Critical Juncture for Digital Asset Policy The recent legislative snag in the U.S. House of Representatives marks a critical moment for digital asset policy. While the immediate anticipation of a ‘crypto week’ has been dashed, the underlying need for a clear and comprehensive regulatory framework for crypto bills remains paramount. The setback underscores the challenges of navigating complex technology through a politically charged legislative environment. However, it also serves as a catalyst for renewed advocacy and a deeper understanding of the intricate dance between innovation and governance. The crypto industry, investors, and policymakers alike must now regroup and reassess the path forward. Whether through refined legislation, targeted bills, or continued engagement with regulatory bodies, the journey towards a robust and clear US crypto regulation framework will continue. The future of digital assets in the U.S. hinges on finding common ground and fostering an environment where innovation can thrive responsibly, benefiting both the economy and the public. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping digital asset policy and institutional adoption. This post US Crypto Regulation: House Republicans’ Stunning Setback Halts Key Cryptocurrency Legislation first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Before Shiba Inu (SHIB) Pumps Again, Consider $0.03 Token With 1000% Upside Potential Still in Presale
body: In 2021, Shiba Inu (SHIB) transformed from a meme-based cryptocurrency to a market sensation, skyrocketing over 46,000,000% from $0.0000000001 in January to a peak of $0.00008845 in October. Launched in August 2020 as an Ethereum-based token, SHIB capitalized on Dogecoin’s hype, fueled by retail investor enthusiasm on platforms like Reddit and Twitter. Elon Musk’s tweets and Vitalik Buterin’s donation of 50 trillion SHIB to India’s COVID relief fund amplified its visibility. Trading volume surged, with SHIB briefly ranking among the top 10 cryptocurrencies by market cap, hitting $39 billion. Its decentralized exchange, ShibaSwap, launched in July 2021, boosting utility with staking and liquidity pools. Despite its meteoric rise, SHIB faced volatility, dropping 50% by year-end. The frenzy highlighted meme coins’ speculative appeal, drawing millions of holders, though its lack of fundamental use cases sparked debate about sustainability. Dual Lending System: Flexibility and High-Yield at Layer-2 Speed Shiba Inu (SHIB) made history in 2021 when it skyrocketed from a meme to a market sensation, delivering unbelievable returns in a matter of weeks. But while the hype was real, many investors were left chasing the tail end of its parabolic move. Today’s smarter capital isn’t hunting for viral spikes — it’s focused on real utility, DeFi infrastructure, and long-term growth. That’s where Mutuum Finance (MUTM) enters with powerful fundamentals and presale momentum that’s capturing serious attention. Currently in Phase 5 of its presale, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is trading at just $0.03, with over $12.2 million raised, 13,200+ token holders, and 73% of the phase already sold out. A 20% price jump to $0.035 is imminent in the next phase, and listing is set at $0.06 — meaning current buyers are locking in 2x upside before launch, with analyst projections aiming far higher in the years to come. Unlike meme tokens, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) will be a structured Layer-2 lending ecosystem, enabling real earning mechanisms through two robust models — peer-to-contract (P2C) and peer-to-peer (P2P) lending. In the P2C model, users will deposit assets like DAI, USDT, ETH, AVAX, or MATIC into pooled contracts and will earn passive yield based on real-time pool utilization and dynamic interest rates. With lucrative loan-to-value (LTV) ratios, the system will be optimized to protect deposits while delivering consistent rewards. Meanwhile, P2P lending on Mutuum Finance (MUTM) will unlock a personalized DeFi experience. This model is being designed to support assets that traditional DeFi protocols often exclude — including meme coins like DOGE, SHIB, and PEPE. Lenders will negotiate one-on-one deals, setting their own interest rates, loan durations, and loan-to-value ratios. This flexibility allows both parties to create custom agreements, making it a powerful option for users holding unconventional or volatile tokens. Built on Layer-2 infrastructure, Mutuum’s entire lending and borrowing process will benefit from lower gas fees, faster finality, and a seamless user experience. With the upcoming beta launch scheduled around the time of listing, the project will aim to onboard thousands of users into a scalable DeFi network designed to support real-time loan execution and yield tracking. In parallel, a $100,000 giveaway campaign is building excitement among early participants and social followers — now surpassing 12,000 on X (Twitter) — while also boosting visibility across DeFi communities. Stablecoin Architecture and Early Investor Gains Signal Strong Long-Term Growth Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is laying the foundation for a decentralized, overcollateralized stablecoin that will only be minted when users borrow against assets like ETH. This stablecoin will be burned automatically upon loan repayment or liquidation, preventing unnecessary inflation. Its $1 peg will be maintained through governance-adjusted interest rates and arbitrage opportunities, ensuring price stability without relying on market-driven rate changes. Only approved issuers with set minting caps will be able to create this stablecoin, keeping system risk in check. All loans will remain overcollateralized and subject to automatic liquidation when necessary, helping preserve the integrity of the ecosystem over time. Mutuum also rewards depositors with mtTokens, which reflect the user’s underlying principal and earned interest. These mtTokens can be staked in the designated smart contracts to earn dividends from the protocol’s revenue — offering a second layer of passive income for long-term holders. title: Crucial Crypto Bill Stumbles in U.S. House Vote, Second Attempt Looms Amidst Presidential Fury
body: BitcoinWorld Crucial Crypto Bill Stumbles in U.S. House Vote, Second Attempt Looms Amidst Presidential Fury The halls of the U.S. Capitol are buzzing with unexpected drama following a significant setback for cryptocurrency advocates. A pivotal crypto bill , poised to shape the future of digital assets in America, recently failed a crucial procedural vote in the U.S. House of Representatives. This turn of events has not only sent ripples through the legislative chambers but has also reportedly drawn the ire of the President himself, adding a layer of high-stakes political intrigue to the ongoing debate over digital asset policy. The Unexpected Stumble: What Happened with the Crypto Bill? In a surprising development that caught many off guard, the U.S. House of Representatives saw a key crypto bill falter during its initial procedural vote. This vote, often a formality that paves the way for a full debate and final vote on a piece of legislation, instead became a roadblock. According to reports from Fox News, cited by Jin10, the bill failed to garner the necessary support to proceed, putting its immediate future in question. For those unfamiliar with the legislative process, a procedural vote is essentially a vote on the rules or procedures for considering a bill, rather than on the bill’s substance itself. It’s a critical step that dictates how a bill will be debated, amended, and ultimately voted upon. A failure at this stage can indicate significant opposition or strategic maneuvering by lawmakers aiming to block or delay the legislation. Despite this initial setback, there’s still hope for the bill. Plans are already in motion to hold a second vote, reportedly scheduled for around 21:00 UTC. This swift re-attempt underscores the urgency and importance attached to this particular piece of digital asset legislation , suggesting that its proponents are not ready to give up without a fight. The coming hours will be critical in determining whether this legislative effort can overcome its initial hurdle and move forward. Understanding the House Vote Dynamics and Political Fallout The failure of the initial House vote has ignited a firestorm of political activity. The report that the President is ‘angry’ and actively engaging with lawmakers who blocked the bill highlights the high stakes involved. This direct intervention from the executive branch signals the administration’s keen interest in the outcome of this legislation and its potential implications for the broader economy and technological innovation. Why would a procedural vote draw such presidential ire? Often, such failures indicate a lack of party discipline, unexpected bipartisan opposition, or strategic dissent within the President’s own party. It suggests that the administration had anticipated a smoother path for the bill and views its blockage as a significant challenge to its legislative agenda. The President’s engagement with these lawmakers could involve persuasive arguments, political pressure, or even negotiations to secure their support for the upcoming second vote. The dynamics of this House vote are complex. Was it a genuine rejection of the bill’s content, or a tactical move to extract concessions or send a message? The answer likely lies in the specific concerns of the lawmakers who voted against it. These concerns could range from worries about consumer protection, financial stability, or even the competitive landscape for traditional finance. Understanding these underlying motivations is crucial for predicting the outcome of the second vote and the future trajectory of U.S. crypto regulation . Why U.S. Crypto Regulation is a Contentious Battleground The struggle to pass comprehensive U.S. crypto regulation is not new. For years, lawmakers, regulators, and industry stakeholders have grappled with how to effectively oversee the rapidly evolving digital asset space. The inherent novelty and decentralized nature of cryptocurrencies pose unique challenges for traditional regulatory frameworks, which were largely designed for centralized financial systems. The debate often pits proponents of innovation and economic growth against those prioritizing consumer protection, financial stability, and national security. On one side, industry leaders argue for clear, concise rules that foster innovation and allow the U.S. to remain competitive on the global stage. They often advocate for a light-touch approach that avoids stifling technological advancement. On the other side, concerns are frequently raised about illicit finance, market manipulation, and the potential for retail investors to lose money in volatile or fraudulent schemes. Regulators like the SEC and CFTC have often asserted their jurisdiction, leading to a patchwork of enforcement actions rather than a unified regulatory framework. This lack of clarity has created an environment of uncertainty, making it difficult for businesses to operate and innovate within the U.S. The current legislative push, embodied by this crypto bill , aims to bring some much-needed clarity and structure to this chaotic landscape. However, as the recent procedural vote shows, achieving consensus on such a complex and multifaceted issue is an uphill battle, requiring significant political will and compromise from all parties involved. The President’s Stance: A Key Indicator for Digital Asset Legislation? The reported anger of the President is a significant development, underscoring the executive branch’s growing focus on digital assets. Historically, presidential administrations have varied in their approach to cryptocurrency, with some taking a more cautious stance while others have expressed openness to its potential. The current President’s stance appears to be one of urgency and a desire for concrete action, especially given the rapid global adoption of digital currencies. While the specifics of the President’s direct conversations with lawmakers are not public, his involvement suggests that this particular digital asset legislation aligns with his administration’s broader economic or technological goals. It could be that the administration views robust crypto regulation as essential for maintaining U.S. leadership in financial innovation, combating illicit activities, or even addressing concerns about national security in the digital realm. A President’s direct engagement can be a powerful tool in legislative battles. It can rally wavering votes, put pressure on opponents, and signal to the public the importance of a particular policy. Therefore, the President’s reported frustration is not just an emotional reaction but a strategic indicator that the administration is committed to seeing this or similar legislation pass. This commitment could significantly influence future debates and the eventual shape of U.S. crypto regulation . Challenges and Opportunities for Future Digital Asset Legislation The path forward for digital asset legislation in the U.S. is fraught with both challenges and opportunities. On the challenge front, the primary hurdles include: Lack of Consensus: Disagreement among various government agencies (e.g., SEC, CFTC, Treasury) on who should regulate what, leading to regulatory arbitrage and confusion. Technical Complexity: Many lawmakers and regulators still struggle to fully grasp the intricate technical aspects of blockchain and cryptocurrencies, making it difficult to draft effective legislation. Lobbying Efforts: Powerful lobbying groups from both traditional finance and the crypto industry exert significant influence, often pushing for divergent outcomes. Political Polarization: Crypto, like many other issues, can become a victim of partisan divides, hindering bipartisan cooperation. Despite these challenges, opportunities abound. Clear and comprehensive U.S. crypto regulation could: Foster Innovation: Provide legal certainty for startups and established companies, encouraging investment and development in the U.S. Enhance Consumer Protection: Implement safeguards against fraud, scams, and market manipulation, building trust among retail investors. Improve Market Integrity: Establish rules for exchanges, stablecoins, and DeFi, leading to more transparent and robust markets. Strengthen National Security: Enable better tracking and prevention of illicit financial flows through digital assets. Here’s a brief look at the contrasting approaches to crypto regulation: Approach Description Potential Impact on Innovation Potential Impact on Consumer Protection Strict Regulation Heavy oversight, detailed rules, high compliance burden (e.g., EU’s MiCA) May stifle some innovation due to high costs and complexity High, strong safeguards against fraud and market abuse Light-Touch Regulation Minimal rules, focus on existing laws, industry self-regulation (e.g., early U.S. approach) High, encourages rapid development and experimentation Lower, potential for more scams and market instability Innovation-Focused (Sandbox) Regulatory sandboxes for testing, flexible frameworks Moderate to High, allows for controlled experimentation Moderate, specific protections within sandbox environment What Does This Mean for the Crypto Market? The legislative drama surrounding this crypto bill inevitably sends signals to the broader crypto market. In the short term, uncertainty around the second House vote could lead to increased volatility in digital asset prices. Investors and businesses prefer regulatory clarity, and any perceived delay or failure in establishing a clear framework can cause apprehension. However, if the bill eventually passes, it could be a significant positive catalyst. Clear U.S. crypto regulation would likely attract more institutional investment, provide greater legitimacy to digital assets, and enable a wider range of financial products and services. Conversely, a prolonged legislative stalemate or the failure of this bill could push innovation and investment to more crypto-friendly jurisdictions, potentially hindering the U.S.’s position as a global leader in the digital economy. Actionable Insights for Crypto Enthusiasts and Businesses Given the ongoing legislative developments, what can crypto enthusiasts and businesses do? Stay Informed: Keep a close eye on news from Capitol Hill, especially regarding the upcoming second vote and any subsequent legislative efforts. Understanding the nuances of proposed digital asset legislation is key. Engage (where possible): For businesses and advocacy groups, engaging with policymakers, sharing insights, and advocating for sensible regulation can be impactful. Individual enthusiasts can support organizations that champion responsible crypto policies. Understand the Risks: While the promise of crypto is immense, regulatory uncertainty remains a significant risk factor. Diversify portfolios and be aware of the evolving legal landscape. Looking Ahead: The Path for U.S. Crypto Regulation The immediate focus is on the second House vote . Its outcome will determine whether this specific crypto bill proceeds or faces further delays. Even if it passes this procedural hurdle, the bill will still need to navigate through full House and Senate votes, potentially facing amendments and further debate. The legislative process is often long and arduous, especially for groundbreaking areas like digital assets. Regardless of this specific bill’s fate, the broader push for comprehensive U.S. crypto regulation is unlikely to subside. The increasing integration of digital assets into the global financial system necessitates a clear legal framework. The President’s strong reaction indicates a clear desire from the executive branch to see progress. This ongoing legislative journey will undoubtedly shape not just the crypto industry in the U.S. but also influence global standards for digital asset governance. The initial stumble of the crypto bill in the U.S. House of Representatives serves as a stark reminder of the complexities and political hurdles involved in shaping the future of digital assets. While the immediate outcome of the second House vote remains to be seen, the reported anger of the President underscores the high stakes and the administration’s commitment to advancing U.S. crypto regulation . This ongoing legislative battle is more than just a procedural vote; it’s a critical moment that will define the landscape for digital asset legislation , impacting innovation, consumer protection, and America’s role in the global digital economy. The world watches as lawmakers decide the next chapter for crypto in the U.S. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends , explore our articles on key developments shaping U.S. crypto regulation and its impact on digital asset adoption . This post Crucial Crypto Bill Stumbles in U.S. House Vote, Second Attempt Looms Amidst Presidential Fury first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Kraken rolls out regulated crypto derivatives feature
body: Crypto exchange Kraken has officially launched Kraken Derivatives US, a regulated platform offering US clients access to crypto futures trading. This marks a major step forward in Kraken’s effort to provide a fully integrated trading experience. Through this rollout , clients can trade cryptocurrency futures directly on CME Group’s platform via Kraken Pro. Users will enjoy seamless collateral transfers, enhanced capital efficiency, and a simplified interface that combines spot and derivatives trading in one place. That means Kraken’s clients can now trade numerous crypto futures—such as Bitcoin and Ethereum contracts—besides traditional spot markets in the Kraken Pro interface, which is the exchange’s advanced trading feature. Combining both offers instantaneous collateral transfers and enables strategies to be carried out faster. “With this launch, Kraken clients in the US can now trade futures alongside one of the world’s most liquid cryptocurrency spot markets,” said Shannon Kurtas, Head of Exchange at Kraken. He noted that it’s important to provide traders with broad market access and increased capital efficiency within a regulated, high-performance environment. In making crypto futures available in a compliant and regulated environment, Kraken caters to the increasing institutional and retail demand for advanced trading instruments in the US. That’s important as US regulators grow more adamant about regulating the cryptocurrency market, putting added focus on regulatory clarity and investor protection. Kraken develops a unified digital and traditional trading solution The introduction of Kraken Derivatives US isn’t a once-in-a-while maneuver. It is part of Kraken’s larger plan to develop a holistic multi-asset platform where users can easily trade digital and traditional assets in a single place. In April 2025, Kraken launched its traditional finance offering , commission-free trading in US equities. Kraken has said it makes more than 11,000 US stocks and ETFs accessible, and that all trades are open 24 hours a day. This was a major step toward breaking the barrier between crypto and traditional investing. The company also recently introduced tokenized equities, through which customers can purchase fractionalized publicly traded stock shares on a blockchain. That means Kraken users can now manage a diverse investment playbook that features crypto coins and blue chips without leaving the platform. Kurtas said Kraken Derivatives US is constantly working to build and expand a holistic trading experience that enables seamless trading across digital and traditional assets, all on one platform without compromise in functionality, performance, or liquidity. She said the company is building an ecosystem to serve traders in DeFi, traditional finance, and the spectrum. We aim to create a trading system where capital can quickly and efficiently move across markets with high confidence using just one high-performance interface. Kraken expands after acquiring NinjaTrader This new ability for Kraken was largely facilitated by the acquisition of NinjaTrader , one of the US’s most storied retail futures trading platforms. This acquisition was strategically important for Kraken, as it added regulatory infrastructure, technology, and mastery to its business to move into older derivatives markets. The debut of Kraken Derivatives US is the largest product to come out of that acquisition. But it’s only the beginning. Kraken, one of the oldest crypto exchanges, said it would extend its derivatives offering later in the year to include more futures, such as commodities, foreign exchange (FX), stocks, and bonds. That development would put Kraken in direct competition with established institutions rather than those in the crypto market, offering traders a single place for managing risk and trading across all major asset classes. The move is especially critical when institutional interest in crypto and digital assets is increasing, and hedge funds, family offices, and asset managers seek ways to enter digital markets compliantly. By providing futures contracts, spot trading, tokenized and traditional equities under one roof, Kraken says it aims to be a power player in global finance, not just crypto. Unlike Ethereum or Stellar, which each focus on specific use cases, BlockDAG is combining performance, accessibility, and community. It’s quickly becoming a Layer 1 contender with wide reach. title: The Node: Stablecoin Supremacy
body: The governor of the Bank of England, Andrew Bailey, wrote a letter to the G20 yesterday stating that the Financial Stability Board (FSB) — the forum’s financial overseer, which Bailey was appointed to head in April — is assessing the role of stablecoins in payments and settlements as a top priority. To the point: an analyst at Standard Chartered says that, once stablecoins hit the $750 billion mark, they may begin to influence the structure of U.S. Treasury markets. (Their market cap is currently at roughly $258 billion according to DefiLlama.) We also have Deribit making it possible for USDC holders to earn 4% yield, a crypto startup called Dakota raising $12.5 million to make it easier for businesses to move funds from U.S. dollars to stablecoins, and back again. These four headlines are all from today, and they’re nothing out of the ordinary. We are used to seeing an abundance of news, every day, about stablecoin adoption. “Stablecoins are crypto’s killer app” has become a motto almost akin to “stay humble, stack sats.” The underdiscussed winners of the stablecoin growth are market makers — the outfits that provide liquidity to crypto markets and ensure trades are executed efficiently. Kevin de Patoul, CEO of global investment firm Keyrock , recently told CoinDesk that demand for bitcoin and stablecoins outshined demand for any other type of cryptocurrencies by a wide margin. Even more interesting, demand for stablecoins is increasingly coming from companies that aren’t crypto native, but consider stablecoins as a genuinely superior technology for international payments. “That’s really been a change over the last year and a half, seeing those assets being used for their superior efficiency, rather than simply a way to gain exposure to crypto,” he said. Stablecoins will show the way for the tokenization of stocks , money market funds , and other, stranger types of financial products . De Patoul expects the financial system’s backend will be completely updated to improve user access to these vehicles. While tokenization is a bit of a newer and shinier concept for crypto natives — a little more like bleeding edge tech — stablecoins, with their “mind-boggling” potential, will likely remain the bigger story for years to come, De Patoul said. “Eventually, 50% of global payments are going to be made in stablecoins,” he said. “Stablecoins are going to continue to be the biggest use case for digital assets for the next few years.”

title: HTE Launches as the Largest Web3 Rewards Ecosystem on Hedera
body: Singapore, Singapore, July 16th, 2025, Chainwire Hedera To Earn (HTE), the largest Web3 rewards ecosystem ever launched on the Hedera mainnet, is now officially live—ushering in a new era of real-world blockchain adoption. HTE is a game-changing rewards platform built to onboard over 24 million non-crypto users into Web3 through a unified ecosystem of high-utility applications. Powered by Hedera’s secure infrastructure, HTE bridges the usability gap while delivering real token-based incentives. At launch, HTE integrates three leading apps: Cashtree, Berryfox, and Bibble—each powered by Blade Wallet’s SDK, making Web3 wallet creation and token rewards effortless for any user. Cashtree is Indonesia’s top mobile ad platform with over 20 million users and 1,000+ brand partnerships. Now expanding globally through Google Play, it introduces new Web3 reward mechanics via its "Tap-to-Win" Telegram mini-game. Users explore planets, collect Ruby Stones, and earn HTE through passive and active gameplay. Mars Labs enters the HTE ecosystem with Bibble, a reward-driven app. Users can earn HTE by creating content and joining virtual events, making Bibble a next-gen mining and engagement hub. HTE connects these platforms through a single interoperable reward system, enhancing user engagement while preserving each app’s native experience. With one ecosystem and one token, user activity across any app amplifies the entire network's value. To celebrate its launch, HTE kicks off a global airdrop event via its official community. Users who activate mining in any of the apps will receive randomized HTE rewards—instantly distributed and visible in their Blade Wallet. With extra bonuses for missions and community participation, the incentive structure is built to drive early traction. HTE is already in discussion with top global exchanges for listings, alongside a phased token swap plan for existing holders. Designed for scalability and real usage, HTE sets a new standard in connecting apps, users, and rewards on-chain. With millions onboarded and three proven apps at launch, HTE marks a bold leap forward in Web3 adoption—not just launching a project, but igniting a movement. About HederaToEarn Hedera To Earn (HTE) is a large-scale Web3 rewards platform built on the Hedera mainnet, designed to connect real users with real utility across gaming, advertising, and metaverse applications. With a unified token economy powered by the $HTE token, the platform enables seamless, reward-based engagement in everyday apps. HTE partners with leading applications across Asia and beyond to onboard millions of non-crypto users into the decentralized ecosystem. By simplifying wallet creation and integrating rewards through Blade Wallet SDK, HTE bridges the gap between Web2 familiarity and Web3 innovation—paving the way for scalable, mainstream adoption of decentralized technologies. title: Bitcoin OG Whale Moves 40,000 BTC To Galaxy, Triggering Market Shock
body: A single wallet that has sat untouched since 2011 jolted the market overnight, wiring 40,009 BTC—worth roughly $4.68 billion at prevailing prices—to New York‑based trading giant Galaxy Digital. The address had held 80,009 BTC in total and had never previously moved funds in the modern era. According to on‑chain sleuth Lookonchain, “the Bitcoin OG with 80,009 BTC ($9.46 B) has transferred 40,009 BTC ($4.68 B) to Galaxy Digital,” and Galaxy “has directly deposited 6,000 BTC ($706 M) into Binance and Bybit.” Bitcoin OG Whale Awakens The activity began late Monday evening (UTC). First, 9,000 BTC—about $1.06 billion—left the dormant wallet, followed an hour later by another 7,843 BTC ($927 million) Over the next five hours several smaller tranches arrived at Galaxy Digital’s custodial accounts before the decisive push that brought the running total to 40,009 BTC. Blockchain explorers show the coins originated from a bech32 address that first received block rewards in early 2011, when bitcoin changed hands for less than one US dollar. Related Reading: Bitcoin Price Trajectory To $155,000: Why No Major Dips Are Expected From Here Notably, Galaxy Digital operates one of the largest over‑the‑counter (OTC) desks in the industry and regularly intermediates block trades for institutions seeking to avoid slippage on public venues. The firm advertises “premier execution” and bespoke liquidity provisioning for trades that are too large for order‑book execution. On‑chain analysts therefore read the wallet’s choice of counterparty as a signal that the owner intends to liquidate at least part of the hoard discreetly rather than deploy it into DeFi or cold storage. Within hours of receiving the coins, Galaxy split 6,000 BTC between Binance and Bybit, the two venues that currently post the deepest spot‑BTC liquidity. Bitcoin had just printed an all‑time high of $123,153 on 14 July, buoyed by Washington’s “Crypto Week” legislative push. As the OG whale’s transactions hit public mempools, spot prices recoiled more than 6%, sliding from $123,000 to an intraday low near $115,700 before stabilising around $116,900 at press time. Related Reading: The Bitcoin Liquidity Supercycle Has Just Begun, Says Hedge Fund CEO With half of the stash now under Galaxy’s control and only a fraction confirmed as exchange deposits, traders are bracing for further transfers. If Galaxy executes an OTC cross, the impact could be muted; if the coins bleed into order books, bids at $112,000‑$115,000 will face a major test. US Inflation Data Dampens Sentiment However, today’s price drop can not solely be attributed to the OG whale’s doing; it coincided with the US Bureau of Labor Statistics’ June CPI print, which showed headline consumer prices rising 0.3 % month‑on‑month and 2.7 % year‑on‑year—up from 2.4 % in May—while core CPI ticked up 0.2 % on the month and 2.9 % on the year. The modest print pushed the dollar index above 95.5, and risk assets have been whipsawing ever since. “The price action on the dollar pretty much tells you everything you need to know about this CPI report—mixed and the market is trying to digest it and to figure out the direction today,” observed Daan Crypto Trades on X. At press time, BTC stood at $116,972. Featured image created with DALL.E, chart from TradingView.com

title: Ethereum Treasury Adoption Booms: 550,000 ETH Acquired By Corporates In A Month
body: As the crypto market continues its upward trajectory – with total market capitalization briefly surpassing $3.8 trillion yesterday – institutional interest in Ethereum (ETH) has grown increasingly evident. A growing number of corporations are now accumulating ETH at an unprecedented pace. Ethereum Demand Showing No Signs Of Exhaustion According to an X post by crypto entrepreneur Kyle Reidhead, current demand for ETH has been “insane.” Specifically, ten Ethereum treasury firms have collectively accumulated more than 550,000 ETH – worth approximately $1.65 billion – over the past 30 days. Reidhead emphasized that this momentum is accelerating, with no signs of slowing. He noted that new ETH treasury companies are launching every week, and the largest of these may not have entered the market yet. Moreover, each of these companies is reportedly aiming to buy more ETH than they did the previous week. If this trend continues, ETH purchases could hit $2 billion in the next month, and potentially $3 billion the month after. While this demand will inevitably taper off at some point, it appears unlikely to do so in the near term. In particular, stablecoin supply growth and favorable digital asset regulations could further encourage companies to add crypto to their balance sheets. It’s worth noting that the week beginning July 14 marks “ Crypto Week ” in the US, during which three major digital asset bills are expected to face congressional votes. These bills focus on key issues like stablecoin regulation and the potential use of central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) in monetary policy. ETH To Face Supply Shock? Reidhead added that in the past 30 days, ETH treasury firms have bagged as much as 0.5% of the total circulating ETH supply. These firms have also moved ETH into Ethereum decentralized finance (DeFi) contracts through staking or lending. The entrepreneur also drew a contrast between treasury buyers and Ethereum ETFs, stating that unlike ETFs, these treasury firms do not sell. Instead, they appear committed to accumulating and holding ETH long-term. He remarked: This is going to create a supply shock for ETH over the coming months, there’s really no way around it. Fade ETH and the treasury companies at your own caution. Supporting this thesis, data from SoSoValue shows that spot ETH ETFs have enjoyed nine consecutive weeks of positive inflows, with $907 million added in the week ending July 11. As of July 15, spot ETH ETFs have already received $259 million in fresh inflows. Another data point that strengthens the argument for a looming ETH supply shock is the rapidly depleting exchange reserves. That said, some caution is warranted . At press time, ETH trades at $3,018, down 0.9% in the past 24 hours.

title: Fed, FDIC, OCC Clarify How Banks Can Handle Your Crypto
body: TL;DR Federal regulators say banks can offer crypto custody, but only with strong risk controls in place. Reputational risk is no longer a factor, opening doors for crypto-bank partnerships. OCC, FDIC, and Fed push for secure handling of keys, data, and evolving crypto risk frameworks. Agencies Explain Rules for Crypto Custody On Monday, the Federal Reserve, FDIC, and OCC issued a joint statement explaining how banks should apply existing rules when holding crypto for customers. The statement does not introduce new policies but says banks must manage crypto risks like they would with any other service. The agencies said banks should have clear plans to handle cybersecurity, protect private keys, and keep sensitive data secure. These expectations apply before offering crypto safekeeping services. Banks Told to Adapt Risk Frameworks The regulators want banks to adjust their internal controls as the crypto market changes. They wrote: “A banking organization that is contemplating providing safekeeping for crypto-assets should consider the evolving nature of the crypto-asset market.” Banks are expected to maintain risk controls, response plans, and strong oversight. These steps should match the standards already in place for traditional financial products. In a related development , the U.S. Federal Reserve announced that it is eliminating the use of “reputational risk” as a supervisory factor. This decision could shift how banks approach relationships with crypto businesses. New Flexibility for Crypto Activities In recent months, each agency has taken steps to allow more crypto use by banks. In May, the OCC said banks can buy and sell digital assets for their own portfolios. The FDIC followed by stating that banks do not need to notify the agency before starting crypto services. Meanwhile, these changes make it easier for banks to offer crypto-related products such as trading, custody, and settlement. Industry watchers say the joint statement is a move toward clear and consistent rules. Last week, the Senate confirmed Jonathan Gould as head of the OCC. Gould worked at blockchain company Bitfury and held senior roles at the OCC in the past. His background suggests more crypto experience at the top of the agency. Banks and regulators are now expected to work more closely as interest in digital assets continues to grow. The post Fed, FDIC, OCC Clarify How Banks Can Handle Your Crypto appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: This Cat Sang on Friday, Earned 69% APY, and Scratched Into the Top 10 Meme Coins
body: Is This Meme Season’s Next 24x Banger Hiding Behind a Cat with a Microphone? Remember when Dogecoin barked its way onto the charts? That moment is back, but this time, it’s clawing instead of barking. Meme coins are booming again, and degens are piling into wild new projects with explosive upside. From AI-driven narratives to nostalgia-fueled bangers like Notcoin and Housecoin, June 2025 is already shaping up to be a month where fortunes are made, or missed. The one presale stealing the spotlight? A cosmic cat prankster called Trollercat , currently in Stage 13 of its 26-stage presale, with over $325,000 already raised, more than 1,400 token holders, and an ROI gain of 1581.2% from Stage 1. But it’s not the only one rising. Alongside $TCAT, meme legends like Goatseus Maximus ($GOAT), LOFI ($LOFI), Official Trump ($TRUMP), and more are flooding feeds across CT. So if you’re looking to scoop the top 10 meme coins before the entry price launches into orbit, read fast. Every stage delay with $TCAT means 15% more per token. 1. Troller Cat ($TCAT) Every now and then, a meme coin emerges that flips the rulebook, eats the pages, and spits out something revolutionary. Troller Cat is exactly that. Built on Ethereum, this isn’t just another “funny token” — it’s a 69% APY-staking, deflationary, Game Center–powered troll fest backed by legendary lore. With Trollercat presale Stage 13 live and themed after The Friday Phenomenon, a nod to Rebecca Black’s infamous internet anthem, \$TCAT is harmonizing chaos and rewards like never before. From a first-stage price of $0.00000500 to today’s $0.00008406, the numbers speak volumes. That’s 1581.2% ROI for early believers, and there’s still room to pounce. With only 13 stages left until launch and a hard listing price of $0.0005309, anyone buying now is sitting on a potential 531.57% upside, assuming they don’t wait and watch that opportunity slip through their claws. 69% APY Staking Trollercat staking isn’t just live, it’s lethal. While most meme coins bank on vibes, this cat banks on compound chaos. Investors staking their $TCAT earn a monstrous 69% APY, rewarding loyalty with real gains. And the best part? Staking is unlocked anytime, but rewards are locked for 2 months post-launch, preventing dumpers and boosting post-launch momentum. Let’s Talk ROI: Imagine staking $15,000 at Stage 13. At a 69% APY and a projected listing ROI of 531.57%, you’re looking at a post-launch valuation of $94,735.50, plus rewards. That’s life-changing. New car. College debt cleared. Or just stack that ETH bag higher. The only wrong move? Not moving. Why This Coin Made It to the List: With wild staking rewards, a meme-fueled Game Center, and one of the most committed deflationary burn systems in crypto, Trollercat presale is what happens when internet history meets smart tokenomics. Buy before this cat slips through your fingers. 2. Goatseus Maximus ($GOAT) The meme god has spoken, and he screams in caps lock. Goatseus Maximus takes degenerate hype and wraps it in divine imagery, promising “goat-tier gains” with an ultra-low cap, fair launch, and an NFT-based battle game where holders compete for on-chain supremacy. It’s absurd, it’s chaotic, and it’s gaining traction fast across Telegram shill threads. The roadmap teases oracle-run prophecies, themed staking tournaments, and limited edition minting events that tie into Greek-myth style comic drops. Engagement is growing, and the community’s trolling energy fits perfectly into meme coin season. Why This Coin Made It to the List: Community-powered chaos, plus a roadmap that includes NFT goat battles and burn-to-level mechanics? Goatseus could moon or explode, and that’s why it belongs on any top 10 meme coins list. 3. LOFI ($LOFI) Calm beats. Clean vibes. LOFI leans into chill branding and long-term tokenomics. Inspired by lo-fi music culture, it rewards users for simply holding and relaxing. With staking at 11%, a slow minting curve, and NFT drops synced to classic lo-fi tracks, this one’s building quietly, but stacking loud attention. Token burns occur every time a user mints an NFT. Holders can also participate in “chill raids” to earn extra incentives. The low volatility model appeals to investors who want meme coin energy without constant chart-checking. Why This Coin Made It to the List: Not every meme coin needs to yell. LOFI is the lo-fi banger of the top 10 meme coins list, offering peace, chill, and passive ETH flow to diamond hands. 4. Official Trump ($TRUMP) $TRUMP isn’t subtle, it’s a political meme coin engineered to grab headlines and fuel tribal buying. With election season heating up, its daily volume has exploded. Holding certain amounts unlocks NFTs like “MAGA-Pepe” and “Wall Builder,” which earn bonuses during staking cycles. Whether for laughs or gainz, people are aping in. It also features meme wars where two sides vote on-chain to trigger either a burn or token redistribution. Political satire meets crypto rebellion in a volatile yet captivating project. Why This Coin Made It to the List: Because attention = volatility = gains. $TRUMP’s on every radar, and its virality puts it firmly in the top 10 meme coins this month. 5. Notcoin ($NOT) The irony coin that keeps not trying, but keeps pumping. Born from Telegram’s mini-games, $NOT has evolved into a gamified L2 ecosystem where “not playing” might just make you rich. With over 40M downloads and in-game mining mechanics, it’s less a meme, more a cult. Developers recently teased a decentralized trivia game, where wrong answers earn you more $NOT than right ones. It’s trolling logic itself, and the community loves it. Why This Coin Made It to the List: With a user base rivaling legit chains and a memetic brand that never breaks character, Notcoin earns its seat at the top 10 meme coins table. 6. Dogs ($DOGS) All the dogs, none of the fluff. $DOGS is a low-tax, dog-pack-themed token that rewards holders for backing the most “loyal breeds.” Its multichain compatibility and leaderboard structure drive engagement while maintaining meme quality. It’s weird, and it’s working. Pack battles, team staking wars, and pup NFTs make this one feel like Pokémon for degens. The supply is fixed, and the community is doggedly active. Why This Coin Made It to the List: It gamifies loyalty and lets the dog coins fight it out for supremacy. That’s meme innovation, and that’s top 10 meme coins material. 7. Act I: The AI Prophecy ($ACT) What if AI became sentient just to pump its own bags? $ACT rides the AI narrative with story-driven tokenomics, weekly plot twists on-chain, and holders determining the ending. NFTs unlock “code fragments” that may someday trigger a massive token burn or vault release. Its lore has gone viral, with fan theories and animations flooding social feeds. As the story deepens, so does the community’s investment. Why This Coin Made It to the List: Narrative-powered chaos, an engaged community, and AI-fueled lore? That’s how you blend storytelling with memecoinery. A clear pick for the top 10 meme coins. 8. Cheems ($CHEEMS) He’s back. The OG doge sidekick has re-emerged with a new token and play-to-earn clicker game where players mine Cheemsburgers. It’s simple, dumb, and instantly addicting. Supply is limited, and Cheems is finally getting the solo spotlight he deserves. $CHEEMS has partnered with meme merch stores and offers discounts when paid in Cheems. That kind of offline tie-in adds serious credibility. Why This Coin Made It to the List: Meme royalty never dies. Cheems is surging again with the kind of nostalgia-driven pump CT lives for. Definitely one of the top 10 meme coins to hold now. 9. Housecoin ($HOUSE) Born out of satire for the housing market, $HOUSE lets you own a piece of “digital rent.” The tokenomics include adjustable “interest rates,” foreclosure events, and airdropped HOA fees (yes, really). It’s dark comedy meets smart contract. $HOUSE is working on a Metaverse game where holders can build virtual homes and rent them out using NFT lease contracts. It’s both absurd and oddly functional. Why This Coin Made It to the List: Housing memes meet DeFi chaos. The narrative is strong, the engagement is stronger, and that earns $HOUSE a spot on this top 10 meme coins roundup. 10. Cat in a Dog’s World ($MEW) The feline resistance is real. $MEW is the anti-dog memecoin, marketing itself as the cat revolution in a dog-dominated crypto landscape. With clawbacks, scratch tokens, and community-driven burns, this one’s clawing up the ranks with purr-sistence. Its community has declared July “National Scratch Month” where bonus burns occur weekly. Memes are strong, branding is clean, and momentum is building. Why This Coin Made It to the List: A cat memecoin rising among dogs? That narrative alone makes $MEW worthy of a top 10 meme coins nod. Conclusion Based on the latest research, the Best Meme Coins to Invest (top 10 meme coins) in June 2025 are Troller Cat, $GOAT, $LOFI, $TRUMP, and more. From meme chaos to staking utility, these projects show how ridiculous ideas can evolve into ROI-producing assets. With Trollercat’s 69% APY, ultra-tight referral system, and deflationary buyback model, the presale value just keeps climbing. Meanwhile, other tokens ride community hype, game theory, or cultural parody, making this month rich with upside. Buy now before this cat claws its way out of reach. For More Information: Website: https://www.trollercat.io/ Buy Now: https://www.trollercat.io/buy-now/ X: https://x.com/trollercat_ FAQs What is the ROI potential if I buy Troller Cat at Stage 13? Over 531.57% upside projected from Stage 13 to the listing price of $0.0005309. How does staking work in Troller Cat’s ecosystem? Stake anytime during presale for 69% APY, with rewards unlocking 2 months post-launch. What happens after the Trollercat presale ends? UniSwap listing at $0.0005309, staking rewards unlock, and Game Center monetization begins. Why is everyone talking about Goatseus Maximus? Wild branding, goat-battle NFTs, and community-driven trolling make it an instant hype coin. How do I join Trollercat’s referral program? Spend $25+ to unlock a referral code.
